SENT.plain: A case of Sturge-Weber syndrome (SWS) with gastrointestinal hemorrhage is presented
SWS is a neurocutaneous disorder characterized by cutaneous facial angioma leptomeningeal angioma with seizures and other neurologic complications
Associated anomalies beyond the encephalofacial territory are very rare
The patient presented repeated bleeds from extensive gastric varices of the fundus secondary to a splenic venous malformation
This is the first report on this association to our knowledge
